metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2180 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The TS_OBJ_print_bio function in crypto/ts/ts_lib.c in the X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol (TSP) implementation in OpenSSL through 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted time-stamp file that is mishandled by the "openssl ts" command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4').
